meanings.definition: Diastereomers: Stereoisomers that are not mirror images of each other.
meanings.sent1: In organic chemistry, diastereomers have different structures but are not mirror images.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study diastereomers to understand their unique properties.
meanings.sent3: The diastereomers decided to go their separate ways in the stereochemistry class.
meanings.sent4: The relationship between the two diastereomers was like siblings who look similar but have distinct personalities.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used colorful blocks to explain the concept of diastereomers to the students.

meanings.definition: Diastereomers: Molecules that have the same molecular formula but different spatial arrangements of atoms.
meanings.sent1: Identifying diastereomers involves comparing the positions of atoms in molecules.
meanings.sent2: Chemists can distinguish diastereomers based on their unique spatial structures.
meanings.sent3: The diastereomers played a game of molecular musical chairs with their atoms.
meanings.sent4: The diastereomers danced around each other, showcasing their distinct atomic arrangements.
meanings.sent5: Visualizing diastereomers helps in recognizing their differences in molecular geometry.

meanings.definition: Diastereomers: Compounds that are not superimposable on their mirror images.
meanings.sent1: When looking at diastereomers, you cannot overlay them perfectly on their mirror images.
meanings.sent2: The unique shapes of diastereomers make them non-superimposable on their mirror reflections.
meanings.sent3: The diastereomers tried to play a game of mirror image charades but failed hilariously.
meanings.sent4: The concept of diastereomers is like trying to fit a square peg into a round hole.
meanings.sent5: The non-superimposable nature of diastereomers is like trying to match puzzle pieces from different sets.
